page.title: 06NATURE ALONG THE RAILWAY
page.content: In 1839 the railway between Gosport and Eastleigh was built.It opened in 1842 after a protest from villagers about spoiling cultivated land.Fields near the railway are cultivated so the cutting is one area where wild life can flourish.At the beginning of the footpath a stile had to be climbed.A number of rotting branches cluttered the pathway.The light was dim under the shadows of the trees,ivy was climbing the trunks of the trees.There were patches of red sweet grasses all around.Mounds of earth arose either side of the path,clumps of stinging nettles added an extra wall to the railway fence.Two trains thundered along the track.We saw a badgers hole in a steep slope.Toadstools were growing in places.We spotted a woodpecker in flight.We also saw a Blue-tit and many acorns on the path.
